entries.question: What will a faithful steward do, and what will be his reward?
entries.authorNote: God requires all His tithe to be returned to Him. To offer a small coin or two as tithe, without calculating the exact tenth is not acceptable to God. One's **total increase** (including that on our gardens, flocks, crops, salaries, etc.) must be divided by ten. Then one full tenth must be returned to God, otherwise it is not a tithe. Many Christians try to lie to God when they offer coins to Him, when such is not their real tithe. These coins are merely an offering if they are not a true tenth of oneâ€™s increase. By doing this, many fail to receive the promised blessings

entries.question: WHAT ARE THE QUALITIES OF TRUE STEWARDS?
What two responsibilities must every steward undertake?
entries.authorNote: Giving an account of your stewardship and being aware of what you owe the Lord are duties which should always be remembered. Records of our tithe due to God are kept in heaven; we may deceive man, but we cannot deceive God.
